name: Westin Maui Resort And Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Westin. I know some reviewers have said that they've encountered a lot of children. We didn't find that to be the case. Perhaps it's because school was still in session?
reviews.title: Wowed by Westin!

likes.liked: — Location, amenities, very posh and well manicured
likes.disliked: — Price. This place is super expensive and imposes a daily resort fee on top of the hotel charge!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are gorgeous. The staff is super friendly and attentive. The pools are fabulous, so are the walking path and the beach. We went swimming everyday. We enjoyed the water slides and did the 2-3 times a day too. :) The hotel is in a wonderful location, just off Whaler's village and close to many shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Just beautiful!!

likes.disliked: — Check-in staff were a bit snooty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a number of activities each day for adults and children alike, from singers to hula dancers. My husband and I were celebrating a special anniversary. They provided us with free champagne and a nice note.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place. We will return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked a partial oceanview room, room 1515. We overlooked the pool, the waterfall and the ocean. We had a lovely patio with two chairs and a small table.
reviews.title: Beautiful Setting, Relax Or Be Active

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a larger than average gym with a huge window that looks out over the resort. It was very nice. It's next door to the spa. It looked really nice, but we did not use the facility.
reviews.title: Truly Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is a bit dated. We did enjoy the pool and the local area. The service was great and took a special interest in making sure the kids had fun. Food? Okay.
reviews.title: SPG, Platinum member review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Westin in Kaanapali is a great place to stay for those looking to be in the heart of the action and close to a great beach. The hotel itself is nice, just in need of a makeover in my opinion.
reviews.title: Great location but needs some updates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We usually stay at a higher end hotel when in Maui so this one just did not compare.
reviews.title: Awesome pool, rooms are tiny!!!
Beautiful grounds, crappy hotel and staff
reviews.text: The hotel is very large and located right on Kaanapali beach. There is a great walking path all down this beach so you can easily visit other hotels and some great snorkeling spots. The pool at the Westin is quite nice, and they have a great waterslide! It is fast and not for small kids that is for sure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a few places to eat, but note that the all the food spots shut down pretty early so if you are looking for a late night drink or snack, anything after 9:30pm, you will need to walk down the beach a bit to one of the other restaurants.
reviews.title: Gigi did a great job for us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki and the Four Seasons Maui, I was a bit disappointed with The Westin Maui. I didn't expect it to be quite as good but I thought it should have been better than what it was.
reviews.title: Westin was OK for adults but great for kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main message I have after staying there: If you have kids, it is GREAT. If you don't have kids, and don't want to be around kids constantly, it is NOT GREAT.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

likes.disliked: — This part of Kaanapali beach is good, but better parts further down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin certainly isn't a quiet place. Even when it was not peak season (I got back a week ago), the resort was still busy. I would definitely not recommend it for couples on a romantic getaway or honeymoon, or older travellers who want a quiet vacation.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The theme of the resort encouraged kids to be there. It was sprawling, there were lots of activities, five interconnecting lagoon pools and water slides, so it was a kid's haven. The resort was also on a lovely stretch of Ka'anapali beach for more swimming and activity.
reviews.title: Pluses and Minuses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: For adults, if you wanted a place with lots of action and enjoy water parks and the beach, it is a great place to be. The main drawback with the pool though is that you HAVE to be there really early to get a deckchair by the pool. There seemed to be a lot of deckchairs, but they were almost completely filled when we first arrived about 11am. Also, only some of the deckchairs were in the shade which made it even more competitive. They asked people not to reserve chairs (in the room information which probably no one read) however most people would get there really early to reserve them and come back (or one member of the family would mind them). If you wanted to spend a day by the pool, and it was really hot, it wasn't that ideal to lay directly in the sun. I think they should have had more shaded areas.
reviews.title: Great beach and fun vacation spot with family

likes.disliked: — Smaller room and not able to meet room type request

reviews.title: Westin --Great place for Kids
reviews.text: I had read previous reviews and was very concerned regarding room size, misc hotel charges and food issues but I have to say our experience was GREAT. We traveled with a 4 and 8 year old and stayed in the beach tower in an ocean facing room. The room was nice size, not too small. Ours had two queen beds with a small sofa. This is a great hotel for kids. The kids program is awesome with different things to do each day so you can pick which day you put your kids in the program depending on what activities their are interested in. There are no words to describe the pool. My kids would have been happy to have spent all 6 days poolside by the waterslide. The food was spendy but it is Hawaii. Meals were slightly cheaper down the path at the Whaler's village restaurants. At times, it was more convenient to just 'bite the bullet' and pay the $25 breakfast buffet at the westin. Kids under 5 do get their meal free per paying adult and kids under 12 pay half the adult price, so this does take the 'edge' off :) !! The staff were very accomodating with everything from concierge questions to having to have engineering come to re-set our safe after our 4-yr old messed up the code. The spa was outstanding. I found the facility to be very clean and accomodating. Overall, we would definitely go back to the Westin.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend a stay at the Westin Resort in Maui.
reviews.title: Fabulous resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds were beautiful with waterfalls, black and white swans, pink pelicans and lush tropical plants. The hotel staff were very friendly and knowledgeable and helped us plan our stay with very pertinent information. The location of this resort is excellent where you can snorkel at Black Rock, walk on the beach, run on nearby trails or golf not far from the hotel. The rooms have been updated and are very clean and well kept. The food at the restaurants on location is good if you choose to eat there and are convenient if pressed for time. We loved this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again!!
reviews.title: Had Fun - Long Review

likes.disliked: — size and location of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: this wasn’t a 5 star luxury experience, but it was a 5 star satisfaction experience. we stayed here at the beginning of may on a starwood promotion and were put into a 2nd floor room with 2 double beds, overlooking the valet parking lot to the right of the entrance as you drive into the resort. the front desk clerk would only upgrade us to ocean view for double our room rate. we stayed at the princeville resort last year on a similar promotion and were upgraded to a beautiful ocean view room at our request free of charge. so at check-in we were already preparing to write a poor trip advisor review. but the resort won us over. as the pix show, the room was very nice, and we had a view of the golf course across the street and the mountains beyond.
reviews.title: Great time @ the Westin Maui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: there were signs of age, such as a missing marble baseboard panel under the bathroom sink and worn flooring under the mini-fridge. the door to the toilet/tub room also opened into the toilet, making access a bit difficult, and the lighting in there was much too dim. the empty mini-fridge was a nice touch, and we were able to load it with snacks and champagne from the star market 2 miles up the road or with takeout or doggie bags from restaurants. the room was right next to a hospitality suite and almost directly across from the 2nd floor promenade that provides access to conference rooms and ends in a stairway leading down to the pool area. however, the hospitality suite was vacant during our stay, and the only noise we heard in the hallway was the occasional sound of staff rolling carts on the service elevator. also, access to the pool area and to our car from our room was very easy by stairs instead of waiting for elevators.
reviews.title: The whales are amazing :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned for a 4 nights stay at the Westin Maui, we had a sea view king room (not deluxe) which was nicer than expected (from reading previous reviews). The room was large enough, clean, not new but not dated either, comfy bed. The room was pretty quiet (10th floor) considering we were very close to the end near whalers village. The balcony was ok, pretty small but they are all the same.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in general

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is about 45 mins drive from airport, yes its cheaper to get a rental, yes some parking spaces were quite tight and some people were taking two spots for their huge cars, but we never had any trouble to find a spot or park our car within the lines.
reviews.title: Just Okay...because of our view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: There are lots of swimming pools, and lots of kids but they had the great idea of putting an adult only pool which was fab as its much more quiet. However, few things to know about the pool.. nowhere is deeper than 1.2m even the adult pool... not much shade so the spots with umbrellas gets "reserved" from early morning by people dropping towels and not returning for hours.. However, if you are not bothered about shaded spot, then you will always find a place.
reviews.title: Left the Hyatt to arrive happily at the Westin!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel ground is very well maintained, with waterfalls, flamingos, ducks, koi fishs, parrots and a few shops (one coffee place that does starbucks coffee)
reviews.title: Starwood Points pay off!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is expensive (but they are all) however it is litterally next door to the Whalers shopping center which has an ABC store and few restaurants. As a lot of guests we got snacks and drinks from there and brought it to the pool, which ended up costing a fraction of what the hotel charges.
reviews.title: Luxurious, but costly!
Expensive! But great location and awesome snorkeling!!
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is *ideal*, but I thought it was very overpriced. It's basically a $150 a night business hotel, at over twice the price. Everything there costs a *fortune*. Get a condo and go to Safeway and you'll save loads of money.

reviews.title: Wonderful resort!
reviews.text: The best part of this hotel is the snorkeling! The best snorkeling I've *ever* done is walking distance from this hotel's beach. Just head to the right up the beach from the hotel to the big black rock - there is a stand there where you can rent snorkel gear for about $5. Swim right out to that rock and around it - there are sea turtles galore, as well as gorgeous coral and every colorful fish imaginable!! Go out early in the morning (I did 7am) and dive down a few feet deeper and you can hear the whale songs loud and clear!! I asked the snorkel gear guy and he said there are 2000+ whales in the water, and you can hear their songs every morning. Incredible.

reviews.title: Westin Maui
reviews.text: However, this is a public beach. Next time I will definitely return to this beach, but won't fork out the $10 for a bagel and coffee or $20 for parking like I did at this place.

reviews.title: Great Vacation...would go again!
reviews.text: Overall: good hotel, great location, very steep price

reviews.title: The best area in Maui
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from Maui. We spent five nights at The Westin and loved it. The pools and grounds are gorgeous, the staff very friendly and courteous, the location perfect. We had a mountain view room on the 11th floor. Each day we were treated to rainbows appearing over the mountains. Yes, the rooms are small as is the closet space, but the beds are wonderful. My only disappointment was the breakfast buffet. I would love to return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in July 2010 for five nights using Starwood points. He is Starwood Gold, Marriott Plat, we own a Marriott timeshare in Hawaii.... needless to say we both stay at a lot of hotels around the world for business and pleasure.
reviews.title: Probably will not stay here again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were both very disappointed in this hotel and will probably not stay here again. The rooms are very average and just not up to Westin standards. They are outdated with very few amenities.
reviews.title: in need of maintaince and remodel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My biggest complaint about this hotel is the pool/beach situation. You can read plenty of reviews on here about that so I'm just echoing the frustration. Be sure to call the hotel weeks in advance to reserve a chair or cabana on the beach. Otherwise, once you get there, it will all be sold out. They offer very few chairs on the beach which I don't really understand. They could easily add more chairs so there are more options. Beach cabanas are a complete joke for what you pay. They are all right next to each other so there is no privacy. We had a cabana next to the one of the end (#2 I think). A family of 6 had rented the cabana so they were all sharing it and sat there and talked the whole time. Annoying. Also, the cabana staff will not take your food order so do not expect any service for your fee. The only thing they would do is keep bringing you tap water and some chopped pineapple. We were there during peak season and the staff informed me that they were understaffed which is why they wouldn't take our lunch order but the waiter could bring us water. Huh? We had to walk to the bar to order lunch. Again, annoying.
reviews.title: A serene magical enviroment where all wants and needs were taken care of far beyond expectation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good thing about this hotel is its location. It is walkable to many restaurant and entertainment options which was very convenient.
reviews.title: Honeymoon bummer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: It was enjoyable because well, hey, you are in Maui. But next time we'll probably stay at the Sheraton or the other Westin property which I've read is much newer and less crowded.
reviews.title: Stayed with my wife and 5 year old...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I elected to stay at the Westin Maui Resort, a late honeymoon of sorts. After precarious start to our vacation (we were charged twice for the same reservation by Westin, and could not obtain a refund for 7-10 days as explained by the accounting department), we were told by Shawn of Customer Relations at the Westin, that he would take care to make sure that our stay would be fantastic.
reviews.title: Over Priced and Roaches on The Service Carts - Vending Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After arriving at the hotel we were given room 753, an ocean view for our stay. As we entered the room we noticed the room did not appear to be clean, nor was it well maintained, damaged furniture, etc... There was tissue left on the ceiling leading out to the balcony. The mold and mildew was unbelievable near the bathroom doorway and at the bar area. We asked for the manager of housekeeping to come up; Austin arrived quickly. Austin tried to do the best he could with the facilities, but he noted, it would be a while before the floor and room could be cleaned properly.
reviews.title: great hotel, you get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I elected to choose another room, 1007, which was in better condition than 753 by large measurable amount, but even at that, the bathroom floors in that room have not been maintained properly. We also noted roaches in and around the ice machine area and we found roaches in our room which probably hitchhiked from the ice machine. I have traveled to many hotels in humid climates including Mexico, South America, and Caribbean, and have never had or noticed roaches in my hotel room.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shawn of Customer Relations and Justin of Housekeeping did their best to make the situation correct. Their positive actions were severely hampered by the facilities. The exterior and grounds of the Westin are great, but the rooms, at least in the main tower are subpar, compared to other Westins.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent for a family vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is obviously priced a higher than several hotel/resorts in the area, but the value of the experience definitely outweighs this. I was in Maui attending a wedding in Lahaina and was able to see several other hotels around the area as I visited other friends and family members. Rooms were typical Westin rooms. It is the ambiance that sets this property ahead of some of the others in the area. The shuttle between the other starwood hotels was very useful. Had a very late flight back on my departure date and was able to use a room for no charge hours after check out to clean up before we flew back to the mainland. This gave us an extra day to enjoy the private beach. Found that the rates dropped around 2 to 3 months out and would consider this to be the best time to book this region.
reviews.title: DO NOT WAISTE YOUR MONEY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Bell lady, Theresa, delivered our baggage in a timely manner and was able to answer all of our questions regarding the resort activities. Our room had a partial ocean and partial mountain view, but I honestly could not tell which view was the best...both were breathtaking. At night we turned off the air conditoner and allowed the breeze and the sound of the ocean from the lanai lull us to a deep sleep. The bedding was truely heavnly and our houskeeper Leonora L.C. kept our room immaculate. The room always had a fresh clean smell upon entering. The buffet breakfast was delicious. There were so many food items to choose from you could almost eat something different every day. My husband and I definitely plan to stay at this resort the next time we travel to Maui.
reviews.title: I did not want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here in July 2010 and i am still thinking about this hotel. everything was perfect, staff was super friendly and helpful, great food, beautiful rooms you name it. the only challenge we had was trying to get pool chairs, which i read from other travelers reviews was an issue also. The staff did their best of removing towels that had been left by other guests to "hold" chairs for hours but sometimes it was a bit disappointing to not be able to find a chair. The beach is amazing also, unfortunately you have to pay for chairs out there and there is a limited amount of chairs you can rent so you have to rent them in advance. Since our young daughter wanted to stay at the pool anyway we would just go back and forth to the ocean. The views from this hotel are breathtaking, i can still picture them in my head as i type this! Also, there are some activities right out on the beach such as banaba boat rides, parasailing and snorkeling cruises which is very convenient. You can also walk down to the Sheraton via a lovely boardwalk past some nice shops and have a cocktail, charge it back to your room and watch the cliff divers.
reviews.title: Love this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed with my wife and two young children (8 and 5 years old) here over the Labor Day weekend. We have been to Maui 6 times in past 7 years, usually staying in Wailea. We picked the Westin in Ka'anapali primarily because it is a Starwood property and I used SPG rewards to book the room.
reviews.title: Good location on the beach; below average Westin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this is a a slightly below average Westin. It has above average common areas, the pool area and the location. It is mostly below average on service, more like a Sheraton than a Westin.
reviews.title: “Very dissapointing hotel - Avoid it”

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: First the positives:
reviews.title: Dawn was amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: I just recently spent an 11 day honeymoon at the Westin. It was absolutely amazing from the moment we walked into the lobby to the moment we left. The property is everything that you could possibly ask for. The best pools, restaurants,easy access to the beach and great views. We did have the mountain view room which alot of people complain about but even with the parking lot below the actual mountain view is breath taking. You would think the parking lot would be noisy but we never heard a sound.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools are well kept and beautiful! If you want a chair next to the adult pool you need to get down there before 8 am. Other than that getting a chair at any other pool was easy.
reviews.title: Excellent view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The restaurants were great and you really need to try the drink sweet Lorraine with vodka it is amazing!
reviews.title: Above and Beyond my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort also gave us a comp box of chocolates, wine delivered to our room and a discount on a couples massage at the heavenly spa ( because we were on our honeymoon) which by the way is absolutely amazing! I highly recommend.
reviews.title: Disappointing stay, well below 4 star expectations and beware the high pressure sales from the concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also recommend the luau...pay for the premium seating it is completely worth it!
reviews.title: Beautiful & Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: First time visitors to Maui can't go wrong with the location of the Westin. It's close to down town and an easy ride to the airport, heliport, zipline, etc. We had no problem finding three chairs together by the pool no matter what time of day it was. If you enjoy laying on the beach, be prepared to pay for a chair. Kaanapali beach is ok but there are much nicer beaches in Wailea. Get out and explore them! Rooms are clean but cramped. There were three of us staying in one room and getting ready could be a bit of a challenge. Food/drinks are extremely overpriced at the Westin but that is to be expected in Maui so be prepared. There is an ABC store at Whaler's Village (right next door) so stock up on water, snacks, etc. See Mike the bartender at the adult pool. He's the best! The one problem we encountered with the hotel staff was the maid. We were sure to lock the sliding door every day before leaving and she always left it unlocked after cleaning. We were on the first floor so this could have presented a huge problem. We'd definitely consider the Westin again if returning to Maui.
reviews.title: Mostly Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband, my baby, and I spent 5 nights at this hotel in May 2008. We thought the lobby, beach, pool, and location were outstanding. When we got up to our room, a felt like I took at trip back to the 1970s. The room needed some serious updating. The carpets, wallpaper, curtains, counters were really worn down. The glass patio table on the balcony was broken in numerous areas. The glass bathroom lamp had a crack that went all the way through. There was dirt on the chairs and tables. I couldn't believe that this room belonged to such a well renowned hotel. I went down to the front desk, the representative assured me that the broken glass on the patio table and bathroom lamp would be fixed. It didn't get fixed until I complained again 2 days later. The overall character of the staff was a big disappointment as well. Any apology was insincere. On the last day we were told by the bellhop that we would be able to use the pool and then wash up in a room before we left. When we attempted this we were told that this was unavailable and had to change in the bathroom instead. again, this was met by a sour apology by the hotel manager who gave me her card and told me that she would "hook me up" next time i stayed at this hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointing Service & Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Many things... LOVE LOVE LOVE the HEAVENLY beds and truly recieved some
reviews.title: Exactlty What I Needed

likes.liked: — The overall hotel is stunning - just beautifully designed
likes.disliked: — The pool is way too crowded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: of the best sleep of my life. (its terrible but two days i stayed in bed and didnt even go enjoy the beautiful hawaiian weather because the beds were just too comfortable!) I also really enjoyed the onsite Spa. The massage I recieved ranks up there with one of the best of my life. The pool area is very crowded but thankfully if you dont have children, there is a designated "adult pool". One experience i was specifically
reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: overwhelmed and grateful for was the generosity of the staff members on my
reviews.title: Wish I could have moved in!

likes.disliked: — Slightly more children than expected, calm ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights at the Westin Maui Resort and enjoyed every minute of it. From the time we arrived, the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. They booked us into a "mountain view" room, which meant we were on the second floor, but we had a distant view of the ocean. It turned out to be a good location, since we could easily get up and down the stairs to the restaurants, pools, and the beach without having to wait for elevators.
reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was an expensive vacation, especially the hotel restaurants, but we found alternatives at Whalers VIllage next door. In addition to a fast-food court, there are a few casual restaurants within walking distance of the Westin that serve good food at reasonable prices. I know that all of the Ka'anapali Beach hotels are now charging the $25 daily "resort fee", but since I was on vacation, I didn't find value in the wireless Internet connection that was used to justify most of that amount. More important than the money spent, however, was that the hotel was comfortable, convenient, luxurious, and relaxing. In addition to five pools on the property, the public beach is easily accessible and we really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Westin Maui Resort and Westin Kaanapali Villas May 8, 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: All of the staff were quite cordial and they created a friendly and welcoming atmosphere. Our last and best interaction with the hotel staff was when we requested help in getting our bags downstairs for check-out. Ronzi came up to assist us and volunteered to get our car for us from the self-park lot. By the time we checked out and went outside, Ronzi had the car ready and was putting the bags in the back for us. When he heard that it was an important anniversary for us, he graciously presented us with two flowers that he had hand-woven from palm leaves. This kind gesture sent us on our way with warm and pleasant memories or our stay.
reviews.title: Wow!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we have the good fortune to return to Maui, the Westin will be at the top of my list.
reviews.title: Fantastic Time - would do again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa May 8-11, 2012 and the Villas May 11-15, 2012. This was our second visit; our first being our honeymoon and now this visit with our 3 yr old son. Rooms were clean, well appointed and included 2 bottles of water and wi-fi. These items and the parking, I believe were included in the $25/ day resort fee that is charged. My wife loved the daily basket of tropical flowers that the Hotel provided to guests at the front lobby. (The flowers are meant to be placed in the hair by the ladies). The large open air front desk and lobby area viewed the waterfalls, lush landscaping, flamingos and koi fish in the in surrounding pond. A morning favorite was Starbucks coffee and a Maui Muffin from the Collonade Cafe (spellng). We ate several times at the Ono Grill and Bar, which had a great kids menu for my 3 year old son. He also loved feeding the Koi fish and chatting with the parrots in the Cafe sitting area. Pools were great and the beach access was even better. The beach front is relatively quiet and fairly deep in width of the sand from the water to the grass area. During our trip we stayed 3 nights at the Westin Maui Resort and 4 nights at the Westin Kaanapali Villas. My wife and I love the Westin Maui Resort and will definitely return. The Villas were also exceptional and have a better kids pool because it is shallow throughout and has a great Pirate ship that they can play on. Rooms at the Villas can be requested with kitchen suites, laundry machines and a separate bedroom. This is great when you have a fussy eater and need to cook as well as being able to put him to bed without having to worry about disturbing him. Both Hotels were exceptional and I would recommend both. However, to sum up the differences between the two: Westin Maui Resort - better for honeymooners, couples, and couples with older children; Westin Kaanapali Villas - better for families with young children.
reviews.title: Excellent - kids loved it
Will Definately Go Again
reviews.text: I was at the Westin Maui for my honeymoon from Dec 2-Dec 10...... I loved it there. Everything was so calm and peaceful! This is the first vacation that i have ever been on that i didn't want to leave. We were given a free room upgrade and got in on a great deal that included free breakfast buffet everymorning, which was quite the impressive spread.

reviews.title: Paradise
reviews.text: There was some construction going on at the hotel but it didn't bother me at all. My only complaint is that the maid service never came around till 3 or so and that was always the time that we wanted to come in from the pool. As they advertise, the beds are amazing. I had no trouble sleeping. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat.If staying there, do yourself a favor and spend the $25 on renting a refrigerator... they seal the fridge for the minibar so there is no where else to put drinks or whatever to keep in your room without one.

reviews.title: Big bucks
reviews.text: We stayed at the Westin Maui in August of 2003 for our honeymoon. The hotel itself is beautiful but we found everything to be way overpriced. It is impossible to afford any food at the restaurants ($9.00 for a bowl of chicken soup) or the snack bar by the pool. One thing to be careful about if you use this hotel is, the service bar refridgerator. We opened up the refrig and found beer, soda and candy in the refrig when we arrived. We saw the prices to use this stuff and went to Safeway to buy our own. We asked at the front desk how to handle using the refrig.- they said just take the stuff from the hotel out and put your stuff in and leave a note for the maid. We left a note and got a note back that if the original stuff was removed we would be charged for the whole contents. We had to check our bill everyday at the front desk to check if we were being charged. They were very nice about it and any charges were reversed but you have to watch out. They also charged us for parking when they wren't supposed to. Again they were nice about reversing the charges but again it is a pain to have to keep checking the bill. So watch that. I also had an incident where I fell in the shower they don't have bath mats and I guess the sunscreen made the floor slippery. They had an EMT come up to the room- very nice and caring. They also gave us big blankets to use on the Road to Hana. Overall, we are going back to Maui in July but would pick a more reasonably priced hotel. It just wasn't our type of place- we felt we couldn't enjoy much of what the hotel had to offer b/c of the prices.

reviews.title: Great Resort
reviews.text: We just returned from the Westin in Maui and I have to disagree with some of the reviews that are posted, we had a wonderful time, our room was a Deluxe Ocean View and we had views of the resorts pools plus the Ocean view. The room was great plenty of room and the Heavenly bed and Bath are to die for!!!, we had the buffet breakfast every morning and it was excellent, the omelet bar is great, everyone that worked at the hotel was helpful and friendly, after reading some of the reviews before we went I was really worried but didn't need to be, when you walk into the lobby there are beautiful waterfalls, flamingo's, ducks and parrots, the landscaping is the best I have seen.

reviews.title: 15-17 year old guys come spring break 2004!!!
reviews.text: It is very kid friendly, there are water slides and waterfalls to play in and the pool is excellent, for restaurants we went to whalers village and down town great food and excellent service, we recommend a sunset meal at the Plantation house it was amazing and the food was awesome. we also travelled to other beaches that were better than at the resorts and had a great time, I would recommend this resort to anyone in fact we are going to return in July with our family, can't wait!!!

reviews.title: It was just OK
reviews.text: we also checked out all the hotels in the resort and this was definetely the best .

reviews.title: Beautiful Resort, Perfect Weather
reviews.text: We LOVE this hotel!!!!!!! in fact we are coming bak spring break 2004 for some partying. the hotel is really cool and lots of fun! if u know any sexy singles between the ages of 15-17, male, bring them along for this week that will be unforgettable...we kno how to show u a good time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 days in early/mid August.
reviews.title: Very nice, very clean, and very busy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was fast and efficient and the desk staff were very friendly. Overall I found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful - what you would expect.
reviews.title: Its a good thing hotel is beautiful...It made up for the lack of service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was nice, clean, had a nice view, and had a mini-refrigerator - which was nice. The room was small, especially considering we have two teenagers but at least we had two queen beds and we really did not spend too much time in the room anyway. The balcony was also nice but small.
reviews.title: Luxurious stay in paradise with everything and everyone available to you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had to pay a $25 resort fee that covered parking and internet. It seemed a bit pricey but at least they were up front about it. And when the lot was full later in the evening they did not charge extra for the valet service.
reviews.title: ONLY A FEW THINGS BAD...
A Great Hotel for Young Kids
reviews.text: As we got there late in the afternoon we decided to eat dinner at the restaurant by the pool. The food was ok, what you typically expect from a hotel restaurant.

aka: Westin Maui Resort And Hotel Lahaina
description: The Westin Maui Resort & Spa, Ka'anapali is located along a breathtaking stretch of the gorgeous, white-sand Ka'anapali Beach.
